etymologies: mid 19th century: from Greek seismos ‘earthquake’ (from seien ‘to shake’) + -ic

definitions: relating to earthquakes or other vibrations of the earth and its crust

examples.text: after a few days of seismic activity the volcanic eruption started

shortDefinitions: relating to earthquakes or other vibrations of earth and its crust

definitions: relating to or denoting geological surveying methods involving vibrations produced artificially by explosions

examples.text: seismic data show the deep structure of rift systems

shortDefinitions: of geological surveying methods involving vibrations produced artificially by explosions

examples.text: there are seismic pressures threatening American society
